results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 09
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine containing the following items: Modernization of Pakistan’s fishing industry; Young people trek through the Rocky Mountains of Canada on horseback; Fire officers from Trinidad and Tobago watch British fire recruits training and the latest British fire-fighting equipment demonstrated; The pyretheum industry in Kenya; The opening of Television Malaysia; The opening to the public of President N’Kruma’s private zoo in Ghana.

results.title: Commonwealth Review. No. 05
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine containing the following items: Driving cattle to market in Northern Australia; Students from Nyasaland and Uganda study the art and science of forestry in England; Malaya diversifies her economy with the establishment of a new tyre factory; A Pakistan librarian staffs a travelling library in Britain; Wildlife in the Wanjie National Park in Rhodesia; A jetboat designed in New Zealand, built in Britain and tested in Canada.

results.title: Commonwealth Meeting, 1965
results.brief_description: Marlborough House in London was the scene of the Commonwealth Prime Ministers Conference, June 1965. A Commonwealth Peace Mission to end the war in Vietnam was the main topic discussed. Prime Ministers took the opportunity of fulfilling other engagements - Mr Holyoake saw a test cricket match between England and New Zealand; Sir Robert Menzies attended a ceremony commemorating the signing of the Magna Carta 750 years ago; all attended a dinner party at 10 Downing Street.

results.title: Comforting your fussy baby (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child Health Series -Revised”.
This short film shows how parents should respond to the needs of their baby, particularly one which cries a lot. Emphasises the importance of tender loving care, and play.

results.title: Come see the dolphins
results.creator_credit: Tom Ascher and Coronet Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Presents the story of a young boy who accompanies his father, a dolphin keeper, to the zoo to see the dolphins. The boy learns of the appearance of dolphins, what they eat and how they communicate and navigate. Skillful photography includes observations underwater and behind the scenes views of equipment and workers needed to maintain the dolphin pool.
